name: Hampton Inn Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility is perfect very comfortable beds, clean rooms, and a pool and fitness room. One can figure $20 for the included hot breakfast, but none of this is prepared on site. As a result the scrambled eggs are little dry scraps, the bacon was floating in grease, the apples were the cheapest not- fully- ripe Red Delicious and the sweet rolls were somewhat soggy packaged goods. Hamptom could do a better job at classing up the "hot breakfast." The quantity doesn't make up for quality.
reviews.title: Great facility, mediocre food

reviews.text: One of the better Hamptons, and I stay in them quite a bit. Clean and comfortably rooms, very quiet at night. The staff is friendly and helpful. Really can't ask for better in a hotel that's under $100 a night.
reviews.title: Quiet and clean

reviews.text: I have stayed at this Hotel many times. It is brand new and extremely clean, nice and marbled throughout but it is located in the middle of no where. A hot/cold breakfast is included and is ok. The staff is very friendly but sometimes talk too much when you are checking in.
reviews.title: Extremely clean, Brand New with Marble throughout, Very friendly Staff, Expensive for area.

reviews.text: This hotel is very spendy, however; compared to the motels you are really not left much of a choice. I am not against motels, but the ones there suck. Not sure about the one connected to one of the casinos there. Sometimes you have to stick with qualtiy and this hotel is that. You will not be disappointed. Please do not stay any where else. You will be disappointed if cleanliness and quality is important to you.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great night sleep, good breakfast, newer Hampton, better than Joplin 20 miles down the road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay at the tired old Hampton in Joplin, MO on this annual drive to/from Phoenix/Chicago but this will be our new stopping spot. The pricing is better than Joplin and being a newer Hampton, it shows! It was quieter and just nicer (being newer). It is exactly what we come to expect at a Hampton and are very pleased it is there!
reviews.title: Excellent stay on our way West

reviews.text: Have stayed here multiple times over the years. Hotel is always clean and staff is friendly and helpful. Never had any problems. Will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great value and consistently good!

reviews.text: My family and I have stayed there twice in the past year. The first time, I had issues with the HVAC in my room. It wouldn't stay on the temperature we set it on. It was in December and I had an 18 month old little boy in the room and it constantly got cold.
reviews.title: iffy....

reviews.text: We just stayed there recently in April for my cousin's wedding. During this stay, at breakfast, I tried to tell one of the employees that I thought the apple juice was empty because it wasn't coming out. This male employee got an attitude with me and mumbled something under his breath and I could not make out what it was. Also, my dad mentioned that this same employee was putting out biscuits at breakfast without gloves on or using the tongs. Made me glad I didn't eat the biscuits that morning.
reviews.title: Best breakfast in a hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed here for a performance at the Coleman Theater which is in the same town. We were rushed for time... so we ate from their snack bar. The food and prices were great. We just heated it up in the microwave in the community area. We did this after the performance too, it was so good. The room itself was great. It is non smoking so we didn't have to worry with that. The breakfast was the best I've had in a motel setting like this. (Not as good as Embassy Suites, but they actually have someone there doing the cooking.) Anyway.. there was something for everyone for sure. Egg, sausage, bagels, muffins, waffles, oatmeal, etc. I could go on as they really did have a lot. If we find ourselves in Miami, OK again, I would be pleased to stay here.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Very friendly staff and clean comfortable stay considering the options in this location we would recommend no other. Excellent staff interaction, food good and considering most would be on/off Hwy driving easily accessable. Great value and we would definitely endorse other travellers
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Miami

reviews.text: I've stayed in almost every hotel in the Miami/Grove/Vinita area, and the Miami Hampton is easily the best of the bunch. It's a Hampton Inn, so it's not exactly luxurious. But the staff is efficient and genuinely friendly; the rooms are comfortably equipped with good tv, good internet, nice work area, and adequate lighting; the cleanliness is above average; the beds are good. I'd like better towels, a larger tv, a nearby restaurant, and a more hygenic breakfast plan, but I'm pretty picky.
reviews.title: Area's Best

reviews.text: We went as a family to see a college football game. We all enjoyed our stay and everyone who worked there was friendly and the rooms were fresh and clean.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfy

reviews.text: We stayed at this Hampton Inn on a recent trip to Arizona. The hotel is in a sparsely populated area just off the Oklahoma Turnpike. The hotel was well-managed and the rooms were spotless and comfortable. The area has very few restaurants and it was necessary to drive into Miami for dinner. The choices for evening meals in Miami are somewhat limited. the breakfast at the hotel was fresh and the choices were good. I'd rate this as an excellent hotel for a one night stay.
reviews.title: Very Well Managed and Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: Although our stay was brief, it was a great place. Room was very clean, beds were extremely comfortable. I'm very particular about the hotels I stay in, and this hotel met and exceeded my criteria. Although we didn't have time to swim or work out, there was a nice indoor pool and a well equipped fitness room. The complimentary breakfast was good and had adaquate food choices. Would, without a doubt, choose this hotel again!!
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while moving across the country from Illinois to Arizona. The front desk was extremely friendly when we arrived and helpful in getting us a place to park the moving truck. The hotel is right off the Interstate, easy to find and easy to get in and out of. The room was spotless and comfortable. We were very tired, and our room was on the first floor by the side entrance so I was slightly worried about noise, but we didn't hear a sound all night. The room is situated in a way that made any hall noise a non-issue. We ordered some pizza to be delivered and they didn't bring us any plates or utensils, however the front staff was extremely helpful and found us everything we would need and more. Overall it was a great hotel, very clean(I am very picky on clean hotels) and everyone was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Moving across the country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We based our stay here on the Hampton reputation for cleanliness and quality and were not disappointed. A great rate didn't hurt either!
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean, Great Rate, Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay in Springfield, MO on our trips to Arizona, but switched to Miami,OK because the hotels were so much cheaper. We will use this hotel from now on-very clean, quiet and comfortable. I can't say that Miami, OK is some traveler's dream destination, but we were happy with the switch.
reviews.title: Friendly, Comfortable, Trouble Free

reviews.text: The room was very clean and neat. It had good internet access. It was in a quiet area and made for a good nights sleep. Overall, if you are in Miami this is well worth your money and is a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: I try to stay at Hampton Inns whenever possible so when my wife and I were looking for a place to spend a night on the road we chose this one. It definitely lived up to the Hampton name. The entire place was clean and welcoming. The young lady working the front desk met us with a smile and made us feel at home. Even the restaurant she recommended was great. We liked it enough we will be staying there again in a few weeks.
reviews.title: Great great great

reviews.text: In the area of Miami, Oklahoma, one doesn't have too many choices in the hotel department. The Hampton Miami is an excellent value option near the Missouri line. The rooms are rather large for a highway Hampton. Everything is clean, and a solid effort has been made to foster the idea that the hotel has been renovated.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Our room had a standing shower only, which was fine for our purposes, but may not work out so well for everyone.
reviews.title: Beyond the Call of Duty
Nice and quiet, comfy bed, good internet. What you expect from a Hampton
reviews.text: Don't expect anything fancy, but there should be no negative surprises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Christmas Eve we were traveling across the country. For Christmas Eve and Christmas morning we found ourselves staying at the Hampton Inn in Miami, Oklahoma. We felt great sympathy for the hotel staff, but they did not seem to mind at all working, and serving us. In fact, Christmas morning the staff prepared the meal 30 minutes early so we could get on the road and reach our next destination for the day. Working early on Christmas Day certainly was beyond the call of duty.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Miami, OK

reviews.text: My only complaint is the 1st room we walked in and it was not made up at all and looked like a disaster (but we did stay Jan 1st, 2012 and were told it was sold out for New Year's and not all the rooms were cleaned). 2nd room was made up but fridge was broken so the 3rd was the charm. That fiasco cost us 30 minutes of running around when we just wanted to get something to eat and sleep for the night to get home but it all worked out in the end and was very quiet and nice clean comfy room.
reviews.title: Nice room - Weird Happenings in the Parking Lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy access off I-44. The room was really nice and clean, big shower. The bed was very comfortable which is always a reason to go back if you are in the area. The radio had an option to play sounds, so we fell asleep listening to the ocean crashing on the beach. Continental breakfast was typical, but area was clean and set up well. Food was kept stocked and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definetely stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with this Hampton Inn. We stayed 1 night as a stopover on our way to Branson, Mo from Fort Worth, Tx. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Coffee and tea was available in lobby 24 hours. We arrived about 9:00 pm. The hotel lobby and breakfast area was immaculate, as well as the room. I am very picky regarding the attractiveness and cleanliness. I loved the large soft towels in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised-very clean and breakfast was awesome

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and was better than expected. Waffles, yogurt, cheese omelets, bacon, cereal, fruit, pastries juice, milk, teas, and a large pitcher of ice water. The breakfast attendant was helpful and very attentive.
reviews.title: I want to stay forever!! =)

reviews.text: We definately will stay here in the future when we make our trips to Branson.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Excellent everything here! I love it! The King-size bed in our suite is sooo comfortable, and I looove the down comforter on it. We are renting the Two-Room Suite for a week, but it may turn into two because we are so comfortable here. We have our 3-year-old daughter here and she loves the indoor swimming pool, though I noticed it is a little cool in temperature. But the pool-room overall, is great and I love the outdoor patio right off the pool area. My husband loves the big flat-screen TV's and the WIFI. The WIFI works fine for our laptop, and we tried to hook up the internet to our x-box, but are having trouble with it. We need the front desk to turn their modem off for 30 seconds and then back on and it would solve the problem, but when my husband went down and asked the front-desk clerk about it last night she didn't know how to do it so we are waiting for shift-change or a manager. We are hoping to solve this problem soon, we've been trying for 3 days to get internet on x-box, but it does work fine for laptop. Overall, this place is awesome!! Very clean, bedding and towels always fresh, no skimping on housekeeping, like some hotels. The Continental Breakfast is amazing, they have just about anything you could want to eat; from hot or cold cereal, to fresh waffles, to fruit, or just yogurt. Also, plenty of beverages to choose from as well, juice, coffee, hot tea, milk, etc. This hotel is fairly new, so it still has that fresh, clean smell throughout. I've stayed at plenty of hotels in the past and I've had my share of problems with some of them. Even to the point where it gets so ridiculous you just have to laugh at your circumstances! (btw, never stay at "The Penn Motel" in PA) This is one of the best hotel stays I've ever had, we've only had one inconvenience so far, and that in itself is good, in my book. I'd definitely recommend this place to anybody who wants to get away and relax for a while!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, horrible wifi

description: We are 100% Hampton, and we guarantee it. Hot Breakfast, Indoor Pool, High Speed Internet, and a Precor Fitness Center all included in the rate. Come by and check out our 74 room/suite brand new property.
